alert.note: Alert for Morgan County; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Northeast Weld County; Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Watch issued April 06 at 12:03PM MDT until April 07 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, northwest winds 30 to 45 mph with gusts up to 65 mph ongoing. For the High Wind Watch, north winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph possible. * WHERE...Briggsdale, Fort Morgan, Limon, and Southern Lincoln County. * WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, until 8 PM MDT this evening. For the High Wind Watch, from Thursday morning through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down tree branches and power lines. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Strong winds will likely lead to rapid fire growth of any new fire. Blowing dust may reduce visibility at times.
info.instruction: Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Use extra caution. Avoid outdoor burning or any activity that may cause sparks. The strong winds will likely fuel rapid fire growth.
